comments.body: https://github.com/pulibrary/pulfalight/tree/issues-224-jrgriffiniii-coll-notes ensures that the relevant EAD2 elements are indexed into Solr. I will proceed next by ensuring that these are rendered for collections and components on the appropriate pages.
https://github.com/pulibrary/pulfalight/commit/afeb56bda62eece1e47ce6536b50943277c2ece2 introduces a Presenter-based pattern for rendering the markup for the collection-level notes.

pulfalight.title: Draft interactive wireframes for each screen featured on PULFALight

comments.body: @Faith Yes, I'm trying to accommodate the deepest hierarchy. This is how it looks at 8 deep, which we have several of (and it fails at this width): So, my first instinct is that we will need to widen it or have a way to manually expand the width of the TOC. However, we can't do that in mobile, so I will try another version with smaller indents so we can get eight deep with label wrapping. Wrapping labels only works if we have the space to begin with. Also, what do you think of using the PUI vocab and call it "Collection Organization" rather than "Content"?

ok, @sdellis; sounds good. thanks. 

And hmmm, think I prefer Contents (or Contents and Arrangement per pulfa 2.0). To me, collection organization, doesn't indicate the ability to discover/browse all of the materials in a collection. Might be a question to pose to our stakeholders.
